section.title: Overview
section.para: ACC_JSON module is used to account transaction information in a JSON dictionary. It binds to ACC module API and uses the same accounting mechanisms as for other backends.
It can output the JSON dictionary to MQUEUE or SYSLOG (even if Kamailio is not using syslog)

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The module depends on the following modules (in the other words the listed modules must be loaded before this module):
acc - accounting module
mqueue - mqueue module (optional)

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para: The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:

listitem.para: Jansson is a C library for encoding, decoding and manipulating JSON data.

section.title: acc_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account a transaction in acc_json. See output_mqueue and output_syslog
Default value is not-set (no flag).

section.title: acc_missed_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account missed calls in acc_json. See output_mqueue and output_syslog
Default value is not-set (no flag).

section.title: acc_extra (string)
section.para: Extra values to be added to the json dictionary.
Default value is NULL.

section.title: acc_time_mode (integer)
section.para: Store additional value related to the time of event.
Values can be:

listitem.para: 0 - (default), save only unix timestamp for syslog and datetime for database.
1 - save seconds in time_attr and microseconds in time_exten.
3 - save formatted time according to time_format parameter, using the output of localtime(). Used for cdr entries too.
4 - save formatted time according to time_format parameter, using the output of gmtime(). Used for cdr entries too.

section.title: acc_time_format (str)
section.para: Specify the format to print the time for time_mode 3 or 4.
Default value is %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S".

section.title: output_mqueue (integer)
section.para: Requires the mqueue module. The acc module will queue json acc events in the specified mqueue. Using a rtimer module exec you can access the queue and process them.
You can also fetch the acc events using mqueue.fetch over JSON-RPC.
Default value is not-set mqueue will not be required.

example.title: output_mqueue usage example

section.title: output_syslog (integer)
section.para: Control if the output of acc json should be sent to syslog. This is not dependent on Kamailio global logging settings, we can use syslog even if Kamailio is not daemonized and/or logging is done to sdtout stderr.
Default value is not-set (no flag).

section.title: acc_log_facility (integer)
section.para: Log facility to which accounting messages are issued to syslog. This allows to easily separate the accounting specific logging from the other log messages.
Default value is LOG_DAEMON.

example.title: acc_log_facility example
example.programlisting:
... modparam("acc_json", "acc_log_facility", "LOG_LOCAL0")
# modify you syslog/rsyslog config # /etc/rsyslog.d/default.conf # remove local0 from default log file # *.*;local0,auth,authpriv.none /var/log/syslog # add local0 to another log file # local0.* /var/log/json_acc.log ...

section.title: acc_log_level (integer)
section.para: Log level at which accounting messages are issued to syslog.
Default value is 1 (L_NOTICE).

section.title: cdr_enable (str)
section.para: Enable Call Data Record generation.
Default value is 0 (disabled).

section.title: cdr_extra (str)
section.para: Set of pseudo-variables defining custom CDR fields.
Default value is NULL.

section.title: cdr_expired_dlg_enable (str)
section.para: Should CDR-based logging be enabled in case of expired dialogs?
0 - off (default). 1 - on.

section.title: cdr_output_mqueue (integer)
section.para: Requires the mqueue module. The acc module will queue json cdr events in the specified mqueue. Using a rtimer module exec you can access the queue and process them.
You can also fetch the cdr events using mqueue.fetch over JSON-RPC.
Default value is not-set mqueue will not be required.
